title: Jamaican Banana Fritters
full_text:
Jamaican Banana Fritters
Close
Jump to recipe
Prep
10 mins
Cook
20 mins
Total
30 mins
Serves
10
Cook Mode
(Keep screen awake)
Ingredients
1 1/2
cups
mashed overripe
bananas
(
14
ounces
;
395
g
) from
4
medium
bananas
1 1/2
teaspoons
(
7
ml
)
vanilla extract
1/8
teaspoon
ground nutmeg
1 1/2
cups
all-purpose flour
(
6 3/4
ounces
;
192
g
)
3/4
cup
(
175
ml
)
milk
or water, plus more as needed
1/4
cup
(
60
ml
)
vegetable oil
, plus more as needed
1 1/2
tablespoons
(
20
g
)
granulated sugar
1/2
teaspoon
ground cinnamon
Kosher salt
, to taste
Directions
In a medium bowl, stir bananas, vanilla extract, and nutmeg to combine. Whisk in flour, followed by milk or water, until a thick and slightly lumpy batter begins to form. (Exactly how thick varies from cook to cook, but a general goal is a batter that’s thicker than pancake batter, spreadable, but not free-flowing.) If needed, add additional liquid, 1 tablespoon at a time, to achieve the desired texture.
Serious Eats / Karina Matalon
In a large sauté or frying pan or nonstick skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat until shimmering. Working in batches to avoid crowding the pan, carefully add a 1-ounce spoonfuls (about 2 tablespoons) of banana batter to oil, making sure to release them close to oil to prevent splashing. Fry until golden on first side, 45 seconds to 1 minute. Flip and fry until golden on second side side, 45 seconds to 1 minute longer. Transfer to paper towels to drain, and repeat with remaining batter, adding oil as needed if pan is dry and adjusting heat to prevent over browning.
Serious Eats / Karina Matalon
In a small bowl, stir sugar and cinnamon to combine. Transfer fritters to a serving dish and sprinkle cinnamon-sugar and salt to taste all over hot fritters. Serve hot or at room temperature as a side dish with a meal or as a quick and tasty snack.
Serious Eats / Amanda Suarez
In a small bowl, stir together sugar and cinnamon. Transfer fritters to a serving dish and sprinkle cinnamon-sugar all over hot fritters. Serve hot or at room temperature as a side dish with a meal or as a quick and tasty snack.
Serious Eats / Karina Matalon
Make-Ahead and Storage
The banana fritters are best eaten immediately.
